full_text: Modifiers impact the rating of a policy. A modifier can increase or decrease a policy premium. You might add a modifier to a product or to a policy line. In this demonstration, I will show you how to access the settings for a modifier in a product. I am going to open the commercial package to access the out-of-the-box example that is set up for modifiers. The commercial package product has one modifier. This is an individual risk premium modifier. There are several rate factors associated with this modifier. Now I will go into the specific factors to see what is included. Clicking here has the same effect as if I clicked in the navigation window. Let me take a look at the building features. Although I can already see the default minimum and maximum, I will show you where you can change the default. I will change these values. You can change the values here in product designer. Modifier availability is also impacted by jurisdiction. I will check into management as another rate factor. As was the case with building features, you can see the default values, but you can also configure them by clicking on the factor. Finally, if I want to add a new modifier, I can do it through this interface. When I click Add, I am prompted to enter several details about the modifier. Since I am not actually configuring a real setup, I will put some test values into the dialog box. In the drop-down for Data Type, four options appear by default. For more information about modifiers, please see the Guidewire document. Filogy of the

segments.text: Modifiers impact the rating of a policy. A modifier can increase or decrease a policy premium. You might add a modifier to a product or to a policy line. In this demonstration, I will show you how to access the settings for a modifier in a product. I am going to open the commercial package to access the out-of-the-box example that is set up for modifiers.

The commercial package product has one modifier. This is an individual risk premium modifier. There are several rate factors associated with this modifier. Now I will go into the specific factors to see what is included. Clicking here has the same effect as if I clicked in the navigation window. Let me take a look at the building features. Although I can already see the default minimum and maximum, I will show you where you can change the default.

I will change these values. You can change the values here in product designer. Modifier availability is also impacted by jurisdiction. I will check into management as another rate factor. As was the case with building features, you can see the default values, but you can also configure them by clicking on the factor.
Finally, if I want to add a new modifier, I can do it through this interface. When I click Add, I am prompted to enter several details about the modifier.
Since I am not actually configuring a real setup, I will put some test values into the dialog box. In the drop-down for Data Type, four options appear by default.
For more information about modifiers, please see the Guidewire document.
